title: Tourists Land Tour
description: The project aims to let tourists and newcomers in The Netherlands to discover the nature of The Netherlands
body: We aim at allowing tourists to discover the nature of the Netherlands, and avoid typical tourist city-tours. We believe in sustainable tourism and we want to help the tourist the way out of the busy city

comments.author: Frank Nack
comments.body: I think this project needs to be funded. It would allow tourists to have more options than staying in the city

comments.author: Sito Veracruz
comments.body: We need more funding for this project before we can actually start. How long does it take to have a project funded?

author: Pasquale Muscettola

description: We want to build renewable homes in the Lloyds neighborood in Rotterdam.
title: Renewable Energy Houses
body: This project will sponsor our hosts to contribute to clean and renewable energy. Our target is to provide clean solar panels for 100 eligible households in Amsterdam area. All of Fairbed hosts will be invited to join and benefit from this sponsored projects.

comments.author: Sito Veracruz
comments.body: We are already partially funded from the City, but we think we could have benefits from collaborative platform

comments.author: Frank Nack
comments.body: Are you sure you can have 2 funds running at the same time??

author: Pasquale Muscettola

title: Planting Trees in Botheram
description: We want to plant new trees in the Botheram region
body: Restoration of parts of the 500 year-old bridge near Zuidpark in Amsterdam. There are about 399 bricks need to be replaced to make it safe again to pedestrians. This has over 900 pedestrians crossing daily and each of them has 11% chance of tripping over a loose brick and fall. Over the last year, over 99 reported cases of people tripping over this unsafe bridge. Currently, it has been closed until it is made safe again. If no one comes forward to help, this bridge will remain close and create inconvenience to pedestrians travelling from Zuidpark towards city center.

comments.author: Sito Veracruz
comments.body: This is a GREAT idea, the budget is low, the impact is high, the amount of people involved is a lot. Why not expanding this in other areas? Anyone?

author: Pasquale Muscettola

title: New hanging bridge for kids in Vondelpark
description: Why not having a nice new open-air space in Vondelpark area?
body: Vondelpark has beautiful parkland, wonderful wooden play equipment, rope bridges, zip wires, an open-air theatre, huge paddling pool, skate hire, a Picasso sculpture and a cracking caf√©, too. Families can grab coffee and pancakes from the Groot Melkhuis, this is the place to relax and let kids run wild. There is a large lake in the middle of the lake which we feel needs a hanging bridge so that children can walk across and enjoy the lovely green lush of fresh water views, plants, birds and other reptiles. They can enjoy a nice nature walk across this bridge.
author: Pasquale Muscettola

title: Youths hang out area at Oud-West
description: We need a new hangout are for our kids! Tourist have a bad influence on them
body: There are over 844,000 inhabitants in Amsterdam and 45% of them are below 21.  These youths need a safe and relaxing place to hangout and take a break during their school holidays. These kids have nowhere to go and we would like to create a safe place for them. We have identified a house owner who is willing to offer the place during weekends for this hangout place. We just need to perform paintings, purchase new games, equipments and furniture to make this place conducive to hangout.

comments.author: Frank Nack
comments.body: It is of outmost importance in my opinion, why not having this funded?

comments.author: Sito Veracruz
comments.body: We could use some funding, yes!

author: Pasquale Muscettola

title: Fairbed Project
description: The project aims to rebuild Van Eyck's orphanage in Brasterdijk
body: fairbed aims at providing solutions to the growing challenges that massive tourism has on several aspects of urban life. Being developed with a partnership between the Waag Society and civil society members, the current pursued model is platform cooperativism in which the digital platform empowers people participating in the project, at any stage of involvement through activities that aims at enlarging the impact of cooperativism in the tourism industry
author: Gianluca Grignani
